Dating: TUTHMOSIS IV/MENKHEPERURE ?; 18TH DYNASTY; AMENHOTEP III/AMENOPHIS III/NEBMAATRE ?
Name: Stela of Kha-em-on Tety
Description: In the lunette is a sun disc with only one wing, on the right a reclining jackal and under them other Abydene symbols.The first register contains the mummiform god Osiris on the left, sitting on a block throne. He is holding a flagellum (nekhakha-sceptre), a was-sceptre and crook (heqa-sceptre) in his hands. In front of him are two offering stands and an offering table opposite a man making the gesture of adoration.The middle register depicts a mirrored scene of a couple sitting on a chair facing a woman libating.The lower register contains a man with a long staff in his left hand and a bag in the right. On the right is an inscription with the offering formula.
